providers.name: OpenAI
providers.description: The industry leader with GPT-4o and GPT-4o mini, powering numerous enterprise applications and services through partnerships with companies like Microsoft, Duolingo, and Stripe

providers.name: Anthropic
providers.description: Notable for its Claude 3 series (Haiku, Sonnet, and Opus), with Claude 3 Opus achieving an industry-leading performance of 84.83% in benchmarks

providers.name: Google
providers.description: Leading the market with advanced models like Gemini 1.5 and PaLM 2, featuring a 1-million token context window and exceptional multilingual capabilities

providers.name: Meta
providers.description: Creator of the LLaMA series, with LLaMA 3.1 featuring 405 billion parameters and a 128,000 token context window. Their commitment to open-source development has made significant industry impact

providers.name: Microsoft
providers.description: A major player through strategic partnerships and innovative projects, including the AutoGen framework for LLM workflow optimization

providers.name: xAI
providers.description: Developer of Grok-1 and Grok-2, with the latter surpassing GPT-4o in several performance metrics

providers.name: Cohere
providers.description: Specializes in enterprise-focused LLM solutions with their Command model, offering powerful text generation and instruction-following capabilities

providers.name: Mistral AI
providers.description: Creator of Mistral Large 2, featuring 123 billion parameters and a 128,000 token context window, known for computational efficiency and strong coding support

providers.name: Databricks
providers.description: Developer of DBRX, an open-source LLM with 132 billion parameters that matches or exceeds GPT-3.5's performance on most benchmarks

providers.name: AI21 Labs
providers.description: Creator of the Jurassic-1 Jumbo model with 178 billion parameters, offering advanced language processing capabilities and the innovative MRKL system
